ThingDef.label: Grass
ThingDef.description: Wild grass. It grows anywhere that there is a little light and minimally fertile ground.

ThingDef.label: Tall Grass
ThingDef.description: Wild Tall Grass is grass that grew exceedingly high. It significantly slows down anyone moving over it.

ThingDef.label: Haygrass
ThingDef.description: A mixture of nutrient-rich grasses that yield large amounts of Hay. Hay is edible for animals, but not humans.

ThingDef.label: Potato Plant
ThingDef.description: Potato Plants produce nutritious tubers called Potatoes. Potato Plants grow quickly and are a reliable food source crop for basic meals.

ThingDef.label: Corn Plant
ThingDef.description: Corn Plants are large grain plants that produce ears of delicious yellow seeds that are called Corn. Corn Plants grow slowly but yeild lots of food. Corn is useful as a food ingredient or for making Ethanol Fuel.

ThingDef.label: Rice Plant
ThingDef.description: Rice Plants are short grain plants that yields numerous amounts of edible seeds called Rice. Rice is useful as a meal ingredient, can be made into Ethanol Fuel or distilled into Sake from the Brewery.

ThingDef.label: Agave Plant
ThingDef.description: Agave Plants are wild, large-leafed desert flowers and the stalks grow into edible Agave Fruits.

ThingDef.label: Strawberry Plant
ThingDef.description: Strawberry Plants produce small, tasty red fruits called Strawberries. These fruits are delicious even when raw.

ThingDef.label: Cotton Bush
ThingDef.description: Cotton Bushes produce Cotton, a fine plant fiber that can be spun from the Tailor's Workbench into a textile called Cloth.

ThingDef.label: Devilstrand Mushroom
ThingDef.description: Devilstrand Mushrooms are slow growing fungi that produce Devilstrand Puffballs, which can be spun into a textile called Devilstrand Cloth. This fungi was genetically engineered to produce a silk net of the highest grade. It is long rumored to have mystical properties and it owes its name to the devilish greed it inspires in people.

ThingDef.label: Healroot Plant
ThingDef.description: A slow-growing plant which yields herbal medicine when harvested.\n\nHealroot was selectively bred for centuries by settlers. It is sometimes also called "healer's hand" by tribespeople - a nickname it owes to its five major medicinal virtues.

ThingDef.label: Hops Plant
ThingDef.description: A Hop Plant is a flowering plant that yields Hops, an essential ingredient in brewing Beer from the Brewery.

ThingDef.label: Blueberry Bush
ThingDef.description: Blueberry Bushes produce tiny, round, blue colored fruits called Blueberries. Blueberries are tasty when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: Cloudberry Bush
ThingDef.description: Cloudberry Bushes produce sweet, amber-coloured, raspberry-shaped fruits called Cloudberries. Cloudberry Bushes are capable of growing well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: Gooseberry Bush
ThingDef.description: Gooseberry Bush produce small, sweet, somewhat hairy fruits called Gooseberries. Gooseberry Bushes can grow in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: Eggplant Bush
ThingDef.description: Eggplant Bushes produce large, purple, egg-shaped fruits called Eggplant Fruit. Eggplant Bushes grow quickly, as the plant is related to the fast growing Potato Plant.

ThingDef.label: Pumpkin Vine
ThingDef.description: Pumpkin Vines produce large, orange squashes called Pumpkins. The fleshy inside of a Pumpkin is great when baked into a pie from the Electric Oven.

ThingDef.label: Bean Stalk
ThingDef.description: A Bean Stalk produces a Bean Pod, a soft shell with small, edible seeds inside. They can be used as a meal ingredient or can be refined into BioDiesel Fuel.

ThingDef.label: Tomato Vine
ThingDef.description: Tomato Vines produce round, palm sized, red, sharp-tasting fruits called Tomatoes. Tomatoes are related to Potato Plants and grow very quickly.

ThingDef.label: Carrot Plant
ThingDef.description: Carrot Plants produce long, crunchy, orange root vegetables called Carrots. Carrots are refreshing to eat raw and have a long shelf life.

ThingDef.label: Cocoa Tree
ThingDef.description: Cocoa Trees produce seeds in pods that are called Cocoa Beans. Cocoa Beans can be refined into chocolate.

ThingDef.label: Sugarcane Plant
ThingDef.description: Sugarcane Plants produce a type of long grass stalk called Sugarcane. The grass stalks are rich in sucrose, which can be milled from the Butcher Table to produce Sugar.

ThingDef.label: Aloe Plant
ThingDef.description: Aloe Plants produce Aloe Leaves, which are similar to Healroots but can be produced as Herbal Medicine Kits from the Canning Stove.

ThingDef.label: Bamboo Stalks
ThingDef.description: Bamboo Stalks produce Bamboo. Bamboo is a fast growing grass that functions as a wood alternative.

ThingDef.label: Tea Shrub
ThingDef.description: Tea Shrubs produce aromatic Tea Leaves. When these leaves are brewed with hot water they make a tasty beverage from the Coffee Machine called Tea.

ThingDef.label: Apple Tree
ThingDef.description: Apple Trees produce round, palm-sized, red fruits called Apples. The Apple Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Apple production.

ThingDef.label: Banana Tree
ThingDef.description: Banana Trees produce long, yellow fruits called Bananas, which eventually soften into a sweet delight. The Banana Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Banana production.

ThingDef.label: Orange Tree
ThingDef.description: Orange Trees produce sweet, citric fruits called Oranges. The Orange Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Orange production.

ThingDef.label: Peach Tree
ThingDef.description: Peach Trees produce soft, fuzzy, sweet fruits called Peaches. The Peach Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Peach production.

ThingDef.label: Grape Vine
ThingDef.description: Grape Vines produce small, sweet berries that grow in clusters on a single branch. These fruits are called Grapes.

ThingDef.label: Champignon Mushroom
ThingDef.description: Champignon Mushrooms produce white or brown edible caps called Raw Champignon. This robust mushroom has been genetically engineered and is cultivated to produce a filling meat substitute.

ThingDef.label: Oat Grass
ThingDef.description: Oat Grass is a cereal grain that produces Oats. Oats are useful as animal feed or can be cooked into food.

ThingDef.label: Wheat Grass
ThingDef.description: Wheat Grass is a cereal grain that produces Wheat. Wheat can be milled from the Butcher Table into Flour, which can be baked into Bread Leaves from the Electric Oven.

ThingDef.label: Coffee Plant
ThingDef.description: Coffee Plants are green, leafy plants that produce red cherries. Coffee Beans are inside of the cherries, and when the Coffee Beans are ground they are can be brewed into a tasty beverage called Coffee from the Coffee Machine.

ThingDef.label: Tobacco Plant
ThingDef.description: Tobacco Plants are a green, leafy member of the nightshade family. Unlike other nightshade plants that produce fruits, Tobacco Plants are grown for their Tobacco Leaves. These leaves are rolled from the Tobacco Rolling Bench and smoked as an addictive drug.

ThingDef.label: Weed Plant
ThingDef.description: Weed Plants produce small, psychoactive buds called Weed. Weed is rolled from the Tobacco Rolling Bench and smoked as a type of addictive drug. It can also be processed into a textile called Hemp made from the Tailor's Workbench.

ThingDef.label: Lettuce Plant
ThingDef.description: Lettuce Plants produce large, edible leaves called Lettuce. Lettuce is an essential component in many salads.

ThingDef.label: Wild Rose Flowers
ThingDef.description: Wild Rose Flowers are from Wild Rose Seeds and produce red flowers called Wild Roses. The plant is also known as the Prickly Rose, Bristly Rose and Arctic Rose. They are used in Herb Collections made from the Tobacco Rolling Bench, Advanced Medicine kits made from the Medical Table, and lastly, into Luxury Meals from the Cook Stove.

ThingDef.label: Hypericum Plant
ThingDef.description: Hypericum Plants produce a type of medicinal flower called Hypericum. They are used in Herb Collections made from the Tobacco Rolling Bench, Advanced Medicine kits made from the Medical Table, and lastly, into Luxury Meals from the Cook Stove

ThingDef.label: Mint Plant
ThingDef.description: Mint Plants are herbs that grow aromatic leaves called Mint Leaves. They are used in Herb Collections made from the Tobacco Rolling Bench, Advanced Medicine kits made from the Medical Table, and into Luxury Meals from the Cook Stove.

ThingDef.label: Onion Plant
ThingDef.description: Onions Plants produce vegetable bulbs called Onions. They are considered to be a luxury crop and are used in Luxury Meals from the Cook Stove. A pungeant chemcial is released when Onions are chopped that can make you cry!

ThingDef.label: Spectago Flower
ThingDef.description: Spectago Flowers are one of the few known breeds of photochromic flowers. The petals can change color throughout the month depending on how much light they are exposed to. So it is no surprise Spectago Flowers produce Rainbow Petals that are used to brew Spectago Tea from the Coffee Machine.

ThingDef.label: Hevea Tree
ThingDef.description: Hevea Trees produce a natural latex, rubber-like sap called Caoutchouc. Caoutchouc can be refined in the Petrochemical Plant through a progress known as vulcanization to create Rubber.
